title: Introduction to msigdbr
text: Pathway analysis common task genomics research many available R-based software tools. Depending tool, may necessary import pathways, translate genes appropriate species, convert symbols IDs, format resulting object. msigdbr R package provides Molecular Signatures Database (MSigDB) gene sets typically used Gene Set Enrichment Analysis (GSEA) software: R-friendly “tidy” format one gene pair per row multiple frequently studied model organisms, mouse, rat, pig, zebrafish, fly, yeast, addition original human genes gene symbols well NCBI Entrez Ensembl IDs without accessing external resources requiring active internet connection Please aware orthologs computationally predicted gene level. full pathways may well conserved across species.

title: Introduction to msigdbr
text: package can installed CRAN. package includes small subset full MSigDB database due CRAN size limitations. Please install msigdbdf package access full MSigDB database:

title: Introduction to msigdbr
text: Load package. gene sets database can retrieved specifying species interest. gene_symbol, ncbi_gene, ensembl_gene columns gene identifiers requested species. db_gene_symbol, db_ncbi_gene, db_ensembl_gene columns gene identifiers database. source_gene column gene identifiers original publication. gs_* columns provide details gene sets. db_* columns provide details MSigDB database, identical entire data frame. can retrieve data just specific collection, Hallmark gene sets. can specify sub-collection, C2 (curated) CGP (chemical genetic perturbations) gene sets. require precise filtering, msigdbr() function output data frame can manipulated using standard methods. example, can subset specific collection using dplyr. version MSigDB database stored db_version column returned data frame.
code: library(msigdbr) all_gene_sets <- msigdbr(species = "Mus musculus") head(all_gene_sets) h_gene_sets <- msigdbr(species = "mouse", collection = "H") head(h_gene_sets) cgp_gene_sets <- msigdbr(species = "mouse", collection = "C2", subcollection = "CGP") head(cgp_gene_sets) all_gene_sets |>   dplyr::filter(gs_collection == "H") |>   head() unique(all_gene_sets$db_version) #> [1] "2024.1.Hs"

title: Introduction to msigdbr
text: helper functions assist setting msigdbr() parameters. Use msigdbr_species() check available species. scientific common names acceptable msigdbr() function. Use msigdbr_collections() check available collections.

title: Introduction to msigdbr
text: msigdbr output can used various pathway analysis packages. Use gene sets data frame clusterProfiler genes NCBI/Entrez IDs. Use gene sets data frame clusterProfiler genes gene symbols. Use gene sets data frame fgsea. Use gene sets data frame GSVA. Earlier versions GSVA (<1.50) need gsva() function.
code: msigdbr_t2g <- dplyr::distinct(msigdbr_df, gs_name, ncbi_gene) enricher(gene = gene_ids_vector, TERM2GENE = msigdbr_t2g, ...) msigdbr_t2g <- dplyr::distinct(msigdbr_df, gs_name, gene_symbol) enricher(gene = gene_symbols_vector, TERM2GENE = msigdbr_t2g, ...) msigdbr_list <- split(x = msigdbr_df$gene_symbol, f = msigdbr_df$gs_name) fgsea(pathways = msigdbr_list, ...) msigdbr_list <- split(x = msigdbr_df$gene_symbol, f = msigdbr_df$gs_name) gsvapar <- gsvaParam(geneSets = msigdbr_list, ...) gsva(gsvapar) msigdbr_list <- split(x = msigdbr_df$gene_symbol, f = msigdbr_df$gs_name) gsva(gset.idx.list = msigdbr_list, ...)

title: Introduction to msigdbr
text: version MSigDB used? MSigDB version stored db_version column returned data frame. can check version used unique(msigdbr_df$db_version). use package can download gene sets directly MSigDB? package makes convenient work MSigDB gene sets R. don’t need download GMT files import . don’t need learn restructure output make compatible downstream tools. don’t need convert genes organism working non-human data. Can convert human mouse genes just adjusting gene capitalization? work , , genes. Can convert human genes organism instead using package? One popular method using biomaRt package. may still end dozens homologs genes, additional cleanup may helpful. Aren’t already similar tools? resources provide msigdbr functionality served inspiration package. WEHI provides MSigDB gene sets R format human mouse. MSigDF recent ToledoEM/msigdf fork provide tidyverse-friendly data frame. updated varying frequencies may based latest version MSigDB. Since 2022, GSEA/MSigDB team provides collections natively mouse don’t require orthology conversion. questions? can submit feedback report bugs GitHub.

title: Introduction to msigdbr
text: Molecular Signatures Database (MSigDB) collection gene sets originally created use Gene Set Enrichment Analysis (GSEA) software. cite use underlying MSigDB data, reference Subramanian, Tamayo, et al. (2005, PNAS) one following appropriate: Liberzon, et al. (2011, Bioinformatics), Liberzon, et al. (2015, Cell Systems), Castanza, et al. (2023, Nature Methods) also source gene set. Gene homologs provided HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee European Bioinformatics Institute integrates orthology assertions predicted human genes eggNOG, Ensembl Compara, HGNC, HomoloGene, Inparanoid, NCBI Gene Orthology, OMA, OrthoDB, OrthoMCL, Panther, PhylomeDB, TreeFam ZFIN. human equivalent within species, ortholog supported largest number databases used. information cite msigdbr R package, run citation("msigdbr").

title: MSigDB gene sets R package
text: package data can accessed using msigdbr() function, returns data frame gene sets member genes. example, can retrieve mouse genes C2 (curated) CGP (chemical genetic perturbations) gene sets. Check documentation website information.

title: Download, cache, and load the gene sets database — load_msigdb_df
code: load_msigdb_df(   target_species = c("HS", "MM"),   overwrite = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Download, cache, and load the gene sets database — load_msigdb_df
text: target_species Species abbreviation human mouse databases ("HS" "MM"). overwrite logical indicating whether existing cached file overwritten. verbose logical indicating whether print progress information.

title: Download, cache, and load the gene sets database — load_msigdb_df
text: data frame gene sets member genes.

what: msigdbr: MSigDB Gene Sets for Multiple Organisms in a Tidy Data Format — msigdbr-package
title: msigdbr: MSigDB Gene Sets for Multiple Organisms in a Tidy Data Format — msigdbr-package
text: Provides 'Molecular Signatures Database' (MSigDB) gene sets typically used 'Gene Set Enrichment Analysis' (GSEA) software (Subramanian et al. 2005 doi:10.1073/pnas.0506580102 , Liberzon et al. 2015 doi:10.1016/j.cels.2015.12.004 , Castanza et al. 2023 doi:10.1038/s41592-023-02014-7 ) R data frame. package includes human genes listed MSigDB well corresponding symbols IDs frequently studied model organisms mouse, rat, pig, fly, yeast.

title: msigdbr: MSigDB Gene Sets for Multiple Organisms in a Tidy Data Format — msigdbr-package
text: Maintainer: Igor Dolgalev igor.dolgalev@nyumc.org (ORCID)

what: Retrieve the gene sets data frame — msigdbr
title: Retrieve the gene sets data frame — msigdbr
text: Retrieve data frame gene sets member genes. original human genes can converted corresponding counterparts various model organisms, including mouse, rat, pig, zebrafish, fly, yeast. output includes gene symbols along NCBI Ensembl IDs.

title: Retrieve the gene sets data frame — msigdbr
code: msigdbr(   species = "Homo sapiens",   db_species = "HS",   collection = NULL,   subcollection = NULL,   category = deprecated(),   subcategory = deprecated() )

title: Retrieve the gene sets data frame — msigdbr
text: species Species name output genes, "Homo sapiens" "Mus musculus". Use msigdbr_species() available options. db_species Species abbreviation human mouse databases ("HS" "MM"). collection Collection abbreviation, "H" "C1". Use msigdbr_collections() available options. subcollection Sub-collection abbreviation, "CGP" "BP". Use msigdbr_collections() available options. category use collection argument subcategory use subcollection argument

title: Retrieve the gene sets data frame — msigdbr
text: tibble (data frame class tibble::tbl_df) gene sets one gene per row.

title: Retrieve the gene sets data frame — msigdbr
text: Historically, MSigDB resource tailored analysis human-specific datasets, gene sets exclusively aligned human genome. Starting release 2022.1, MSigDB incorporated database mouse-native gene sets split human mouse divisions ("Hs" "Mm"). one provided approved gene symbols respective species. versioning convention MSigDB format Year.Release.Species. genes within gene set may originate species different database target species indicated gs_source_species db_target_species fields. Mouse MSigDB includes gene sets curated mouse-centric datasets specified native mouse gene identifiers, eliminating need ortholog mapping.

title: msigdbr 10.0.2
text: CRAN release: 2025-04-14 Updated tests.

title: msigdbr 10.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2025-03-19 Updated documentation.

title: msigdbr 10.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-03-12 Removed MSigDB data (now separate package msigdbdf). Updated package versioning scheme tied MSigDB release. Added support mouse versions MSigDB (msigdbr() gains db_species argument). Updated annotation fields returned gene sets. Updated msigdbr() arguments gs_cat gs_subcat gs_collection gs_subcollection.

title: msigdbr 2023.1.1
text: Based MSigDB v2023.1.Hs release. available CRAN.

title: msigdbr 2022.1.1
text: Based MSigDB v2022.1.Hs release. available CRAN.

title: msigdbr 7.5.1
text: CRAN release: 2022-03-30 Based MSigDB v7.5.1 release.

title: msigdbr 7.4.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-05-05 Based MSigDB v7.4 release. Added Ensembl gene IDs returned gene sets.

title: msigdbr 7.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-10-02 Based MSigDB v7.2 release. Added annotation fields returned gene sets. Added msigdbr_species() alternative msigdbr_show_species(). Added msigdbr_collections().

title: msigdbr 7.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-05-14 Based MSigDB v7.1 release. Increased ortholog prediction stringency.

title: msigdbr 7.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2019-09-04 Based MSigDB v7.0 release. Fixed output selecting multiple collections.
